byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and MARLISE SIMONS

abstract: South Africa says it plans to leave International Criminal Court, prompting fears of devastating large-scale withdrawal of African countries; several African leaders charge court disproportionately focuses on African violations; announcement comes three days after Burundi announced plans for withdrawal.

headline.print_headline: South Africa to Leave International Court
headline.main: South Africa to Withdraw From International Criminal Court

snippet: The move, reflecting concerns that crimes in other parts of the world are not adequately addressed, has prompted fear of an African exodus from the tribunal....
lead_paragraph: The move, reflecting concerns that crimes in other parts of the world are not adequately addressed, has prompted fear of an African exodus from the tribunal.
